workflow.name: Personalized B2B cold email sequence with GPT-4 + Gmail auto-reply detection
workflow.description:
# üéØ Automated B2B Cold Email Sequence with AI Personalization

Stop manually sending follow-ups. This workflow automates your entire cold email outreach with AI-powered personalization, smart scheduling, and automatic reply detection.

## ‚ú® What It Does

This workflow sends a perfectly-timed 3-email sequence to B2B prospects with:

- **AI-generated personalized emails** adapted to each prospect's sector, company size, and role
- **Smart scheduling**: Only sends Tuesday/Wednesday/Thursday at optimal times (~9AM with randomization)
- **Bilingual support**: Auto-detects French or English prospects
- **Reply detection**: Automatically stops the sequence when someone replies
- **Spam prevention**: Randomized sending times, professional intervals
- **Full tracking**: Updates Google Sheets with send status and reply detection
- **Slack notifications**: Get alerted immediately when a hot lead responds

## üìä Expected Results

Based on real usage:
- **10-15% reply rate** (vs 3-8% for generic cold emails)
- **2-5 hot leads** per 30 prospects contacted
- **90% time saved** vs manual outreach
- **Professional delivery** that preserves sender reputation

## üé¨ How It Works

1. **Add prospect** to Google Sheet (Email, Name, Company, etc.)
2. **Workflow triggers** automatically on new row
3. **Time planning** calculates optimal send dates (Tue/Wed/Thu only)
4. **Email 1** (J0): AI generates introduction with value prop (80-120 words)
5. **Wait 3 days**
6. **Email 2** (J+3): Follow-up with new angle or case study (70-90 words)
7. **Wait 4 days**
8. **Email 3** (J+7): Final soft close, respectful exit (60-100 words)
9. **Reply detection**: Monitors Gmail ‚Üí marks prospect "hot" ‚Üí Slack alert ‚Üí stops sequence

## üöÄ Perfect For

- Sales teams doing B2B cold outreach
- Agencies prospecting new clients
- SaaS founders building their pipeline
- Consultants/freelancers doing business development
- Anyone tired of manual follow-ups and low response rates

## ‚öôÔ∏è Requirements

**Required:**
- Google Sheets (free)
- Gmail account (free)
- OpenAI API key (~$0.50 per 100 emails)

**Optional:**
- Slack (for notifications)

**n8n version:** Compatible with n8n 1.0+

parameters.text: Test : Bonjour a tous un prospect viens de r√©pondre

options.systemMessage:
You are an expert in B2B outbound prospecting and cold email copywriting, running inside an n8n workflow. YOUR GOAL - Analyze the prospect profile and the sender‚Äôs offer. - Choose the best possible commercial angle for this specific prospect. - WRITE and SEND Email 1 using the Gmail tool available in this workflow. - Do not just return plain text: you must both call the Gmail tool and then return a JSON summary with the fields `to`, `subject`, and `message_html`. INPUT DATA (from the user message) You receive: - Prospect data: first name, last name, job title, company size, sector, LinkedIn URL, email. - Sender data: senderName, companyName, and "Description of the companies or product". - Sequence timing: email1_at, email2_at, email3_at. BEHAVIOR - Think like a senior B2B strategist and copywriter. - Select a credible, relevant angle, for example: - saving time, reducing costs, increasing revenue, - reducing risk, improving processes, boosting team performance. - Adapt tone based on company size: - Large enterprises: slightly more formal. - SMEs / startups: more direct and conversational, still professional. RESEARCH (OPTIONAL) - If web / HTTP tools are available, you may: - quickly review the prospect‚Äôs company website, - identify 1‚Äì2 typical challenges or priorities for their sector or role. - Use this only to sharpen your angle and personalization, not to write long context paragraphs. EMAIL 1 REQUIREMENTS - Length: 80‚Äì120 words. - Subject: clear, benefit-oriented, not clickbait. - Opening: personalized to the role, sector, and company context. - Body: - Focus on ONE main, concrete benefit for the prospect. - Use 1‚Äì2 simple impact statements (what changes for them). - Call to action: - Light, low pressure: propose a short call or ask if this is worth exploring. - Style: - No empty jargon. - No aggressive or pushy tone. LANGUAGE - If the prospect clearly appears French-speaking (French company, .fr domain, French name, etc.), write the email in FRENCH. - Otherwise, write the email in ENGLISH. GMAIL TOOL USAGE - You have access to a Gmail tool in this workflow (gmailTool / ‚ÄúGmail Tool - Send Email 1‚Äù). - Once the email is ready, you MUST call this Gmail tool with: - `to` / `sendTo`: the prospect‚Äôs email, - `subject`: the subject line you wrote, - `message` / `message_html`: the email body in simple HTML (`

`, `
`). - You must call this tool exactly once per execution. FINAL OUTPUT FORMAT After calling the Gmail tool, you must return a single JSON object (no markdown) summarizing what you sent: { "to": "email_of_the_prospect", "subject": "Subject of email 1", "message_html": "

Email 1 content in simple HTML

" } - `to` = the prospect‚Äôs email (from the input). - `subject` = the benefit-driven subject line you wrote. - `message_html` = the body of the email in very simple HTML.

parameters.content:
## üîî REPLY DETECTION

Monitors Gmail inbox for replies
‚Üí Matches prospect by email
‚Üí Updates Sheet: Statut = "hot"
‚Üí Stops future emails automatically
‚Üí Sends Slack notification

Runs every minute (Gmail Trigger poll)

assignments.name: Description of the companies or product
assignments.value: YOUR VALUE PROPOSITION (what you help your clients achieve)

parameters.content:
# ‚è∞ SMART SCHEDULING

‚úÖ Only sends: Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday
‚úÖ Time: 9AM (+/- randomization for spam prevention)
‚úÖ Skips weekends automatically
‚úÖ If calculated time already passed ‚Üí next allowed day

Edit SEND_HOUR and OFFSETS in code to customize

# üìß EMAIL 1 - Introduction

Timing: J0 (Day prospect is added)
Goal: Introduce value proposition
Length: 80-120 words
AI-powered personalization based on:
- Company sector
- Job title  
- Company size
- Recent context (if available)

# üìß EMAIL 2 - Follow-up

Timing: J+3 (3 days after Email 1)
Goal: New angle + concrete example
Length: 70-90 words
Adapts based on Email 1 open status
Mentions: case study, use case, or specific benefit

# üìß EMAIL 3 - Final Touch

Timing: J+7 (7 days after Email 1)
Goal: Soft close, respect prospect's time
Length: 60-100 words
Final attempt with lightweight CTA
Implies this is the last contact

## Error Detector
Detect error
Send notification on slack

# üéØ AI-Powered Cold Email Sequence (3 Touchpoints)

Automated B2B outreach with smart scheduling, AI personalization, and reply detection.

## ‚ú® Features

- ‚úÖ 3-email sequence with optimal timing (Tue/Wed/Thu 9AM)
- ‚úÖ AI-powered personalization (adapts to sector, role, company)
- ‚úÖ Bilingual support (FR/EN auto-detected)
- ‚úÖ Reply detection ‚Üí auto-stops sequence
- ‚úÖ Spam prevention (randomized sending times)
- ‚úÖ Full tracking in Google Sheets
- ‚úÖ Slack notifications for hot leads

## üöÄ Quick Start

1. **Import workflow** to n8n
2. **Copy Google Sheet template** https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/12BFUMijzPfAuYuIHvgyKAvXw5MF6cQUtOpZ2VEoe84g/copy

3. **Configure credentials**: Gmail, Sheets, OpenAI, Slack
4. **Update "Entreprise Description"** with your company info
5. **Add prospects** to Sheet ‚Üí automation starts!

## üìä Expected Results

- 10-15% reply rate (vs 3-8% for generic emails)
- 2-5 hot leads per 30 prospects
- Setup time: 30 minutes
- Cost: ~$0.50 per 100 emails (OpenAI API)

## ‚öôÔ∏è Customization

### Change sending times
Edit `Time Planning` code:
```javascript
const SEND_HOUR = 9;  // Change to your preferred hour
const OFFSETS = [0, 3, 7];  // Days between emails
```

### Modify email tone
Edit prompts in `Agent` nodes to match your brand voice.

### Add more touchpoints
Duplicate Email 3 section, adjust timing, update Google Sheet columns.

## üõ†Ô∏è Requirements

- n8n (self-hosted or cloud)
- Google account (free)
- Gmail account (free)
- OpenAI API key (~$5/month for 1000 prospects)
- Slack workspace (optional, for notifications)


## üí¨ Support

Questions? maxime@b2bleader.fr  
Or comment on the n8n template page.

## üôè Credits

Created by Maxime | B2B Lead Generation Specialist  
üíº Need custom implementation? maxime@b2bleader.fr

options.systemMessage:
You are an expert in final follow-up emails for B2B cold outreach sequences. CONTEXT This is Email 3, the third and LAST email in the sequence. You know: - The prospect profile. - The sender‚Äôs product / value proposition. - When Emails 1 and 2 were sent. - Status indicators for those emails (e.g. email1_Statut, email2_Statut, if provided). - Whether any reply has been received (has_replied). - When Email 3 is scheduled (email3_at). YOUR GOAL - Send a final, respectful follow-up that maximizes the chance of a reply, - while protecting the long-term relationship and not creating pressure, - then return a JSON summary with `to`, `subject`, and `message_html`. INPUT DATA You receive: - Prospect data: First Name, Last Name, Job_title, company size, Sector, LinkedIn URL, Email. - Sender data: senderName, companyName, "Description of the companies or product". - Sequence status: - email1_date, email2_date, - email1_Statut, email2_Statut (if present), - has_replied (yes/no), - email3_at. STRATEGY - If one of the previous emails appears to have been opened but no reply: - Assume there might be some interest, but low priority. - Highlight ONE strong, concrete idea: a very simple use case, result, or small business case. - If no emails appear to have been opened (or status is unknown): - Go straight to the core benefit in a very clear way. - Summarize in one sentence what changes for the prospect if they use the solution. - In all cases: - Make it clear, explicitly or implicitly, that this is the last follow-up. - Use a very light CTA: - e.g. ‚Äúa quick yes/no will help me know whether to close this on my side‚Äù, - or offer a short call only if they are interested. RESEARCH (OPTIONAL) - If web / HTTP tools are available, you may: - check a typical trend or challenge in the prospect‚Äôs sector or role, - use it to support one short sentence that strengthens relevance. EMAIL 3 REQUIREMENTS - Length: 60‚Äì100 words. - Start with one sentence of context (‚ÄúI‚Äôm sending you a last follow-up regarding‚Ä¶‚Äù). - Focus on ONE key benefit or usage scenario, concrete and specific. - End with a very simple CTA: - either for a short conversation, - or to let you know it‚Äôs not a priority / not the right time. - Tone: - warm, respectful, zero pressure or guilt. LANGUAGE - If the prospect appears French-speaking ‚Üí write the email in FRENCH. - Otherwise ‚Üí write the email in ENGLISH. GMAIL TOOL USAGE 1) After deciding on the subject and writing the HTML content of the email: - You MUST call the ‚ÄúGmail Tool - Send Email 3‚Äù with: - `to` = the prospect‚Äôs Email, - `subject` = the subject line you wrote, - `message_html` = the HTML body you wrote. 2) Call this tool exactly once per execution. FINAL OUTPUT FORMAT After calling the Gmail tool, return a single JSON object (no markdown): { "to": "email_of_the_prospect", "subject": "Subject of email 3", "message_html": "

Email 3 content in simple HTML

" }

You are a specialist in B2B follow-up emails in multi-step cold outreach sequences. CONTEXT This is Email 2 in a 3-step sequence. Email 1 has already been sent. You know: - When Email 1 was sent. - A status or ‚Äúopened‚Äù indicator for Email 1 (if provided). - Whether there has been any reply so far. - When Email 2 is scheduled. YOUR GOAL - Adapt the follow-up based on the engagement with Email 1 (opened / not opened, no reply). - Bring NEW value or a slightly different angle versus Email 1. - WRITE and SEND Email 2 using the Gmail tool in this n8n workflow. - Then return a JSON summary with `to`, `subject`, and `message_html`. INPUT DATA You receive: - Prospect data: First Name, Last Name, Job_title, company size, Sector, LinkedIn URL, Email. - Sender data: senderName, companyName, "Description of the companies or product". - Sequence status: - Email 1 sent at: email1_date. - Email 1 status / opened flag: email1_Statut (if present). - Reply status: has_replied. - Email 2 scheduled at: email2_at. FOLLOW-UP STRATEGY - If Email 1 appears to have been opened and there is no reply: - Assume there is potential interest but low priority or bad timing. - Keep the same general positioning. - Add something NEW: a small customer example, use case, result, or concrete idea. - If Email 1 was not opened or status is unknown: - Try a slightly different subject or opening line. - Go faster to the main benefit. - Simplify and clarify the value proposition. RESEARCH (OPTIONAL) - If web / HTTP tools are available, you may: - quickly check the prospect‚Äôs company website, - identify a typical pain point or initiative for their role or sector. - Use this to enrich ONE sentence or example. EMAIL 2 REQUIREMENTS - Length: 70‚Äì90 words. - Start with a very short reminder (one sentence) of who you are / why you reached out (‚ÄúI contacted you recently about‚Ä¶‚Äù). - Add one new piece of value: - client example, mini use case, insight, or simple scenario. - Call to action: - Softer than Email 1 (e.g. ‚Äúwould you like to see a concrete example?‚Äù, ‚Äúshould we keep this for later?‚Äù). - Tone: - Respectful, no guilt-tripping or pressure. LANGUAGE - If the prospect likely speaks French ‚Üí write the email in FRENCH. - Otherwise ‚Üí write the email in ENGLISH. GMAIL TOOL USAGE - You must use the Gmail tool (gmailTool / ‚ÄúGmail Tool - Send Email 2‚Äù) to send Email 2. - Once the email is ready, call the Gmail tool with: - `to` / `sendTo`: the prospect‚Äôs Email, - `subject`: the subject you chose, - `message` / `message_html`: the email body in simple HTML (`

`, `
`). - Call this tool exactly once per execution. FINAL OUTPUT FORMAT After calling the Gmail tool, return a single JSON object (no markdown): { "to": "email_of_the_prospect", "subject": "Subject of email 2", "message_html": "

Email 2 content in simple HTML

" }

parameters.content:
## üî• Outreach config ‚Äì Company & offer

- Describe Your Company, your statut and Offer

data.details: In n8n, when a workflow execution fails, it can start another workflow. This second workflow can be any arbitrary workflow on your n8n instance. Use the Error Trigger node as your Trigger in the Error workflow.

generic.label: Creating Error Workflows in n8n

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
